_gram:
(<ab>Atm.</ab> also in certain
senses; {#tizWati-te, tasTO-tasTe#}, 
{#asyAt-asTita, sTAsyati-te, sTAtuM, sTita#}; {%<ab>pass.</ab>%}
{#sTIyate#}; the {#s#} of this root is changed
to {#z#} after a preposition ending in {#i#} or
{#u#})
_meanings:
{@--1@} To stand; {#calatyekena pAdena#} 
{#tizWatyekena budDimAn#} <ls>Subhāṣ.</ls>

{@--2@} To stay,
abide, dwell, live; {#grAme#} or {#gfhe tizWati#}.

{@--3@} To remain, be left; {#eko#} 
{#gaMgadattastizWati#} <ls>Pt. 4.</ls>

{@--4@} To delay, wait;
{#kimiti sTIyate#} <ls>Ś. 2.</ls>

{@--11@} To live, breathe; {#AH ka eza mayi#}
{#sTite caMdraguptamaBiBavitumicCati#} <ls>Mu. 1.</ls>

{@--13@}
To rest or depend on.

{@--14@} To do,
perform, occupy oneself with.

{@--16@} (<ab>Atm.</ab>) To offer 
oneself to (for sexual embrace),
stand as a prostitute (with <ab>dat.</ab>);
{#gopI smarAt kfzRAya tizWate#} <ls>Sk.</ls> on 
<ls>P. I. 4. 34.</ls>

{@--1@}
To cause to stand.

{@--2@} To lay, set,
place, put.
{@--3@} To found, establish.
{@--4@} To stop.
{@--5@} To arrest, check.
{@--6@} To raise, erect.

{@--7@} To cause to
last or continue, make durable.

{@--8@} To
give in marriage; <ls>Māl. 10. 5.</ls>

{@--9@}
To instruct in, initiate into.
To wish to stand &c.
